headline: Ahead of Market: 10 things that will decide stock market action on Wednesday
description: Indian markets ended lower Tuesday as the Sensex fell 624 points and Nifty declined 175, dragged by profit booking in Financial and IT stocks amid weak global cues and muted FII activity. Mid- and small-cap stocks showed resilience, backed by strong Q4 results.

headline: NMDC Q4 net rises 2% to ₹1,496 crore, up 19% in FY25 to ₹6,693 crore
description: The company has declared a final dividend of ₹1 per share

headline: Balrampur Chini unveils eco-friendly input for making single-use products
PG Electroplast block deal: Government of Singapore buys shares worth Rs 288 crore in multibagger smallcap
description: The Government of Singapore purchased ₹288 crore worth of PG Electroplast shares at a 2% discount via block deal, while BNP Paribas bought ₹10 crore in Suraksha Diagnostic. PG Electroplast posted 107% YoY profit growth in Q4FY25 despite recent stock correction.

headline: Cred To Raise $75 Million From Existing Investors
description: The company's plans to raise fresh funds augurs with its plans to focus on development and adoption of its new product offerings.

headline: Two Sharp with ET | IBM lays off 8,000 in AI reset, Sensex falls 625 pts as IT & Financials drag
Bosch Q4 Results: Profit drops 2% to Rs 554 crore
description: Auto components firm Bosch on Tuesday said its consolidated profit after tax declined 2 per cent to Rs 554 crore in the fourth quarter ended March 31, 2025, amid challenging business environment.

headline: Israeli firm SolarEdge’s India GCC to monitor  inverters/optimisers deployed across 24 geographies
description: The team in Bengaluru will remotely perform troubleshooting tasks by diagnosing problems such as  fault in meters and inverters and attend to error messages 24/7

headline: ET Market Watch: Sensex slumps 625 points; what triggered the drop?
BAT considers reducing its stake in India's ITC
description: British American Tobacco said on Tuesday it is considering further reducing its stake in Indian consumer goods company ITC in a potential on-market sale.

headline: Large deal momentum, improving profitability keep Coforge stock buoyant
description: Coforge shares rose 13% since May 5, outperforming the BSE IT index, driven by strong revenue growth, record deal wins, and margin expansion in Q4 FY25. The company retained its $2 billion FY27 revenue target, secured a $1.56 billion deal with Sabre, and reported a 48% rise in executable order book despite macro uncertainties.

headline: Trump Media To Raise $2.5 Billion In Capital To Buy Bitcoin
description: Trump Media will add Bitcoin to its balance sheet along with its current cash, cash equivalents and investments, which were worth $759 million.

headline: Trump Media to raise $2.5 billion to invest in bitcoin
description: Trump Media and Technology Group will raise about $2.5 billion to invest in bitcoin, U.S. President Donald Trump's social media firm said on Tuesday, as it looks to diversify its revenue streams with a push into the financial sector.

headline: TVS Motors, Mahindra Top Auto Picks As Two-Wheelers, Tractors Drive Growth
description: Two-wheelers and tractors are poised for positive growth, while the heavy and medium commercial vehicle segment is predicted to remain flat.

headline: US Stock Market Today: S&P 500, Dow Jones, Nasdaq Jump 1% As EU Trade Deal Cheers Wall Street
description: Shares of Tesla, along with chipmakers Advanced Micro Devices and Super Micro Computer, were among the key gainers in early trade.

headline: LIC declares Rs 12 final dividend after strong FY25 earnings, sets record date
description: LIC dividend 2025: LIC has proposed a ₹12 final dividend per share for FY25, pending AGM approval. With an 18.38% profit rise to ₹48,151 crore, the insurer also reported increased premium income and allocated ₹56,190 crore as bonuses to policyholders, reinforcing its market dominance.

headline: Nasdaq, S&P rise 1% at open after long weekend on Trump's trade reprieve
description: Wall Street opened higher on Tuesday after U.S. President Donald Trump dialed back his threat of tariffs on EU imports, defusing trade tensions between the United States and the European bloc and boosting investor confidence.

headline: Tata Steel Seeks Rs 757-Crore Compensation Over Cancelled Odisha Coal Mine
description: The Supreme Court had canceled the allocation of the New Paratpara Coal Block in Odisha in 2014 amid the coal scam allegations of the UPA era.

headline: Chennai Petroleum Corporation gets govt nod for foray into retail marketing of petrol, diesel
description: Petroleum and Natural Gas Ministry conveyed the government’s approval to the company to exercise retail marketing rights to market Motor Spirit and High Speed Diesel, CPCL informed stock exchange on May 27

headline: These 5 stocks hit 52-week high and rally up to 39% in a month
description: Despite Sensex falling 625 points, five BSE500 stocks hit 52-week highs, signaling strong momentum. Top gainers include Bharat Dynamics, CCL Products, and Maharashtra Scooters with sharp monthly gains.

headline: Coal India arm CMPDI files DRHP with Sebi for an IPO
description: Ranchi-based CMPDI, a Coal India subsidiary, filed its draft red herring prospectus for an IPO comprising a 7.14 crore share offer for sale by Coal India. CMPDI, India’s leading coal consultancy, posted Rs 667 crore profit in FY25 with zero debt, aiming for listing to enhance operational autonomy.

headline: Finwizz and Wishfin merge to build a leading omni-channel financial platform, eye IPO in 24 months
description: Finwizz and Wishfin are merging to form a tech-driven, omni-channel financial distribution platform targeting IPO in 24 months. The combined entity leverages Finwizz’s distribution and Wishfin’s digital strengths, aiming to scale credit aggregation and attract strategic capital.

headline: LIC Q4 Results: Cons PAT jumps 38% YoY to Rs 19,039 crore; Rs 12 per share dividend declared
description: LIC Q4 Results: LIC reported a robust 38% YoY growth in Q4FY25 consolidated net profit, reaching Rs 19,039 crore, and announced a final dividend of Rs 12 per share. While net premium income saw a slight dip, the full financial year witnessed an 18% increase in PAT to Rs 48,151 crore.

headline: Commodity Radar: Initiate long position on MCX Zinc futures for this target
description: Zinc prices slipped amid global metal weakness and weak Chinese demand. Despite China's economic support, sentiment stayed cautious due to US credit downgrade and trade tensions. Prices hovered in a tight range, with technical indicators hinting at a breakout soon.

headline: LIC Q4 Results: Profit Rises 38%, Net Premium Income Falls
description: LIC Q4FY25 Results: Net premium income slipped 3.2% to Rs 1.48 lakh crore versus Rs 1.53 lakh crore.

headline: LIC Dividend Of Rs 12 Per Share For FY25— Check Record Date
description: The board has fixed July 25 as the record date to determine the eligibility of shareholders for the proposed final dividend.

headline: Breakout Stocks: How to trade GE Vernova, Bharat Dynamics & Eris Lifesciences that hit fresh 52-week high?
description: Indian markets ended a two-day winning streak, with the Sensex dropping over 600 points and Nifty50 falling below 24,900. Realty and telecom stocks gained, while auto and IT sectors declined. GE Vernova T&D, Bharat Dynamics, and Eris Lifesciences hit new highs.

headline: Bharat Dynamics Q4 Results: Profit Down, Margin Narrows
description: The missile systems manufacturer declares a dividend of Rs 0.65 per share for the fiscal ended March 2025.

headline: Traditional Banks Threatened By Fintech, Non-Bank Challengers — AI Can Help: BCG Report
description: Successful implementation of artificial intelligence can be a game changer, but many banks still struggle in this area.

headline: Govt extends income tax returns filing deadline to September 15, 2025 from July 31
description: The announcement comes following significant outrage on social media among the chartered accountant community, who complained that the government had not yet released the software utilities to enable the filing of the ITRs.

headline: Japan's Fujita Corp-Backed Neilsoft Refiles For IPO With Reduced Fresh Issue
description: The company plans to allocate approximately Rs 63.5 crore from the net fresh issue proceeds towards capital expenditure.

headline: Kolkata-based Fusion CX files DRHP with Sebi to raise Rs 1,000 crore through IPO
description: Fusion CX Limited has filed for a ₹1,000 crore IPO, comprising a ₹600 crore fresh issue and ₹400 crore OFS. Funds will support debt repayment, IT upgrades, acquisitions, and global expansion. The company serves 197 clients across 15 countries.

headline: China to collect record $22 billion BRI debt repayments from developing nations this year
description: Under its influential BRI initiative, China has doled out billions of dollars of loans to dozens of infrastructure projects in developing countries to further its global influence

headline: Share market update: Most active stocks of the day in terms of traded value
description: The NSE Nifty index closed 174.96 points  down  at 24826.2

headline: Apple shares face More Pain as Trump’s Tariff Threat Looms
description: Apple Inc. shares are coming off their longest selloff in more than three years, as escalating attacks from the White House threaten to further erode the company’s profit outlook, suggesting the stock’s struggles this year are far from over.

headline: Naukri.com Parent Firm Declares Final Dividend; Reports Seven-Fold Jump In Q4 Profit
description: Info Edge (India) Ltd., parent of Naukri.com, will disburse a total amount up to Rs 47 crore to its shareholders via dividend.

headline: In This Economy: Apple, Trump And The India Shift — What’s Really Going On?
description: Simple – tariffs or no tariffs, it’s still far cheaper than moving production to the US.

headline: Sensex Falls 625 Points, Stock Market Ends Lower On Profit Booking
description: The Indian stock market closed in the red on Tuesday due to profit booking, driven by valuation concerns and weakness across the Asian markets.

headline: Slow EV Growth Doesn't Deter Global Push Into India's Car Market: Moody's
description: The slow uptake is attributed to limited charging infrastructure, high upfront costs and consumer hesitancy.

headline: Sensex  falls! But these  stocks gained over 10% on BSE
description: In the Nifty 50 index, 11 stocks ended in the green, while 39 stocks closed in the red in today's trade.

headline: Fujita Corp-backed Neilsoft refiles draft IPO papers; cuts fresh issue size
description: Fujita Corporation-backed Neilsoft Ltd has refiled its draft papers with markets regulator Sebi to raise funds through an initial public offering (IPO). The IPO will have a combination of a fresh issue of shares worth Rs 90 crore and an offer-for-sale (OFS) of 80 lakh shares by promoters and existing shareholders, according to the draft red herring prospectus filed on Monday.

headline: Stock market update: Stocks that hit 52-week highs on NSE in today's trade
description: Camlin Fine Sc,  Apollo Micro Systems,  Centum Elec,  Suven Life Sci and  Racl Geartech, hit their fresh 52-week highs during the day.

headline: Rakesh Gangwal, family trust sell 5.7% stake in IndiGo for Rs 11,559 crore
description: InterGlobe Aviation promoter Rakesh Gangwal and his family trust on Tuesday sold a 5.7 per cent stake in the airline for about Rs 11,559 crore (USD 1.36 billion) through a block deal, according to sources.

headline: HDFC unit is said to near SEBI nod for $1.5 billion IPO
description: HDB Financial Services is nearing regulatory approval from SEBI for its IPO, potentially raising $1.5 billion. This listing, a unit of HDFC Bank, could be India's largest IPO for a shadow bank and a significant test for the IPO market. Tata Capital is also planning a substantial IPO, indicating a potential resurgence in Indian listings.

headline: Sitharaman Visits Pine Labs, Witnesses Demonstrations Of Fintech Solutions Under Development
description: The demonstrations were related to fintech solutions being developed around prepaid instruments, the account aggregator framework, and digital services used in the public distribution system.

headline: Instamart drops parent 'Swiggy' in rebranding move for quick commerce platform
description: Instamart has unveiled a fresh logo, which contains the Swiggy 'S-Pin' icon as "a subtle tribute to the brand's origins", the company said

headline: It’s a buy-on-dips market until Nifty crosses 25,200 barrier decisively: Ajit Mishra
description: Ajit Mishra of Religare Broking suggests the Nifty may consolidate briefly, but anticipates a breakout above 25,200 driven by banking and financial sector strength. He recommends a buy-on-dips strategy, favoring stocks over the index until the 25,200 level is decisively breached. Mishra highlights SBI and Vedanta as potential picks, noting favorable risk-reward in SBI and a possible breakout in Vedanta.

headline: Rupee weakens alongside Asian peers as dollar finds footing
description: The Indian rupee and its regional peers weakened on Tuesday as the greenback rose against major peers and Asian equities declined, with rupee traders also pointing to month-end dollar payments from importers that weighed on the local unit.

headline: India Aiming For $1 Trillion Exports In FY25, Hoping For US Mini Trade Deal Next Month: FIEO
description: Order books have started filling up again after a slow one-two month phase, said Federation of Indian Export Organisations President SC Ralhan.

headline: NSE's valuation jumps 60% with IPO looming: Sources
description: Anticipation of an upcoming IPO has propelled the National Stock Exchange of India's valuation to $58 billion in private markets, fueled by aggressive buying from wealthy investors. This surge coincides with efforts to resolve a longstanding legal dispute hindering listing plans. The exchange is also strategizing to regain market share in equity derivatives, aiming to surpass its competitor, BSE Ltd.

headline: Government Plans Centralised Exporters Portal; Piyush Goyal To Meet  Export Promotion Councils Today
description: The proposed portal will be designed to serve as a one-stop platform for global importers to discover Indian goods and services across sectors.

headline: Quick Heal, Netweb Technologies among 10 IT stocks that fell 30-60% in CY25
description: The BSE IT index has significantly underperformed in CY25, declining by 14% against the Sensex's 5% gain. Several IT stocks have experienced substantial drops, with ten companies falling between 30% and 60%.

headline: OYO begins discussions with banks for IPO
description: Global travel tech platform OYO in discussions with bankers for IPO, targeting $6-7 billion valuation in Q4 FY25

headline: Coal India Arm Central Mine Planning & Design Institute Files IPO Papers
description: The public offer consists of an offer for sale of 7.14 crore shares by Coal India.

headline: Trump tariff impact: Ford, Diageo, Mercedes among other global cos hit pause on guidance
description: The unpredictable policy environment, along with frequent changes and revisions to tariffs, has prompted numerous companies across various sectors to suspend or withdraw their financial guidance for upcoming quarters or fiscal years.

headline: Gland Pharma, SBFC Finance among 10 smallcap stocks where FIIs raised stake in Q4
description: Foreign institutional investors increased their holdings in several Nifty500 small-cap stocks during Q4 FY25, reflecting rising confidence in select names like Aptus, Sammaan, JB Chemicals, and Zee Entertainment.

headline: Max Financial, HDFC Life, SBI Life On CLSA's Radar As Regulatory Concerns Ease
description: CLSA said regulatory concern for the banca channel was now in the behind.

headline: SMFG stake buy in Yes Bank to pave way for other foreign entrants in Indian banking sector: Fitch
description: Fitch Ratings on Tuesday said Sumitomo Mitsui Financial Group's (SMFG) 20 per cent stake buy in Yes Bank could pave way for other foreign entrants in the Indian banking sector. India's foreign investment norms cap voting rights for investors in banks at 26 per cent and investments by financial institutions in Indian banks at 15 per cent, which have deterred such stake sales, its said.

headline: Jio Finance Share Price Up After BlackRock JV Receives SEBI Approval For Mutual Funds Business
description: JioBlackRock Asset Management Private is a 50:50 joint venture between Jio Financial Services and BlackRock.

headline: Japan's super-long bond yields fall sharply after heavy sell-off
description: Yields on super-long Japanese government bonds (JGBs) fell sharply in early trade on Tuesday as investors snapped up bargains following recent steep sell-offs.

headline: Why are central banks choosing gold over Bitcoin? Peter Schiff revives debate amid record bullion buying
description: Economist Peter Schiff reignites the gold vs. Bitcoin debate, questioning why central banks continue to record gold purchases over crypto. With over 1,000 metric tons of gold being bought annually, Schiff argues that gold’s stability and central bank trust underscore its dominance as a reserve asset amid global dollar scepticism, unlike Bitcoin, which remains volatile and unadopted institutionally.

headline: Jindal Poly Films Gets Closure Notice From Industrial Safety Department
description: A major fire broke out at Jindal Poly Films' plant at Nashik on May 21. The smoke had been continuously rising from the plant for the last six days.

headline: Sensex Crashes 1,000 Points In Volatile Day Of Trading
description: Indian equities crashed this morning after rallying for two sessions, with investors turning cautious ahead of the release of key data on the country's economic performance.

headline: Maharashtra To Cancel E-Bus Orders With Olectra Greentech Over Delays, State Transport Minister Confirms
description: Maharashtra government had expected at least 1,200 buses by May 2025, but that did not materialise, the state transport minister Pratap Sarnaik said.

headline: Heard On The Street: Dealers Spot Action In Tata Chemicals, BHEL, PG Electroplast And More
description: This edition of ‘Heard On The Street’ provides you with buzzing action on stocks like Tata Chemicals, BHEL, Elgi Equipments, Samvardhana Motherson and PG Electroplast.

headline: Stocks to Buy | Why Prateek Agrawal Prefers Growth Over Value Investing Today
description: Prateek Agrawal favours growth investing over value, citing low oil prices, steady demand, and multi-sector expansion as key drivers for India’s equity markets.

headline: Seasonal FMCG products lose shine amid tepid Q1-Q2 outlook: Abneesh Roy
description: Early monsoon arrival is anticipated to positively impact FMCG sector, boosting rural income and sentiment, though some categories like ice cream may face adverse effects. Experts suggest focusing on companies benefiting from improved crop availability and benign inflation. While urban recovery is expected, summer-related consumer durables might experience weaker demand due to the altered weather patterns.

headline: Celebi Contract: Bombay High Court Stops MIAL From Taking Final Decision On Ground Services Bids Till June
description: Turkey-based airport ground handling services major Celebi's subsidiary had moved HC last week against revocation of its security clearance and subsequent termination of its contract with MIAL.

headline: Airbus, Tata To Set Up Helicopter Assembly Facility In Karnataka
description: This makes the facility the first privately led helicopter assembly facility in the country.

headline: JioBlackRock Asset Management gets SEBI approval for mutual funds business
description: The company plans to launch a range of investment products, including those that apply BlackRock’s industry-leading capabilities in data-driven investing, over the coming months

headline: Fear gauge India VIX spikes 8% in a week. Here are 3 tips to avoid a crash
description: Nilesh Jain, Head Vice President of Equity Research (Technical and Derivatives) at Centrum Broking, observed that market volatility has remained high over the last two to three sessions, with the India VIX climbing from about 15 to 19. He explained that this spike is largely due to a significant buildup of call writing positions, which is capping any short-covering attempts and establishing a firm resistance around the 25,000 mark.

headline: Crypto Prices Today: Bitcoin slips below $110,000 amid profit booking; Altcoins fall up to 5%
description: Bitcoin price today: Bitcoin slipped below $110,000 amid profit booking, while altcoins declined up to 5%, reflecting cautious sentiment. Despite short-term weakness, institutional interest remains strong with steady ETF inflows and major purchases. Analysts view the dip as consolidation, with BTC support at $105,200 and resistance at $111,000. Market watchers are also eyeing regulatory developments and FTX-related liquidity events.

headline: Export boost: Government restores RoDTEP scheme, allows leather exports from all ports
description: The RoDTEP scheme benefits, which reimburses exporters for certain duties, taxes, or levies, were available till February 5 of this year, following which export bodies lobbied hard for an extension

headline: No value in market, it’s time of growth investors; focus on alpha generation in new spaces:  Prateek Agrawal
description: Prateek Agrawal of MOAMC sees India benefiting from low oil prices, potentially leading to lower inflation and interest rates, favoring risk assets like equities. He highlights growth opportunities in emerging sectors beyond index performance, including EMS, renewable energy, and defence. While valuations are a concern, strong earnings and a weaker dollar could fuel further market rallies.

headline: KEC International Highlights Manpower Shortage As Biggest Challenge Despite Strong Order Book
description: KEC International CEO Vimal Kejriwal said that the company is currently short of nearly 5,000 workers across its civil and transmission & distribution verticals.

headline: Stocks to Buy | Decoding Smart Capital: Sectors, Stocks & Strategy with Anshul Saigal
China, HK stocks slip as auto sector drops amid heightened scrutiny
description: China and Hong Kong shares fell on Friday, weighed down by losses in the auto sector amid increased regulatory and consumer scrutiny.

headline: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman To Meet India Inc On GST Reforms On Tuesday
description: Discussions will focus on rate rationalisation, the future of the compensation cess, and broad structural reforms in the GST system, sources said.

headline: Consumer Discretionary To Benefit As Disposable Income Rises, Says Franklin Templeton's Ajay Agral
description: Tax-cut effect has started to trickle in and more rate cuts are expected from the Reserve Bank of India, Franklin Templeton Senior Vice President and Portfolio Manager Ajay Agral said.

headline: Nikkei reverses course to end higher as yields fall sharply, yen weakens
description: Japan's Nikkei share average reversed early declines to end higher on Tuesday, as a weaker yen and falling yields on super long-dated bonds lifted sentiment.

headline: European shares steady as defence stocks climb on Russia sanctions threat
description: European shares remained stable on Tuesday, supported by defence stocks after U.S. President Donald Trump threatened additional sanctions on Russia, though broader gains were restrained by ongoing caution over U.S. trade policy shifts.

headline: Japan poised to sweeten offshore wind rules as players get cold feet
description: Japan needs to revive its offshore wind plan to meet the 2040 target; Developers secured for one-tenth of targeted 45 GW capacity; Industry seeks rule changes to offset soaring costs, price risks

headline: Garden Reach Shipbuilders, IDFC First Bank, Aster DM — Mid-Cap Stocks To Watch
description: Experts from Reliance Securities and Hem Securities have shared their insights on these stocks, highlighting their potential for growth.

headline: Phillip Capital bets on ICICI Lombard, Max Financial as insurance sector recovery takes shape
description: Phillip Capital has initiated coverage on India’s insurance sector with a bullish outlook, favouring ICICI Lombard and Max Financial as top picks, expecting over 20% returns. The brokerage highlights sector recovery as regulatory pressures ease, growth improves, and valuations stay attractive, with strong long-term tailwinds from rising insurance penetration and market expansion.

headline: The Leela IPO booked 9% on Day 2 so far; GMP at 2.5%. Should you subscribe?
description: The Leela IPO, valued at Rs 3,500 crore, consists of a fresh issue worth Rs 2,500 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) totalling Rs 1,000 crore. The IPO opened for subscription on May 26 and will close on May 28. Share allotment is expected on May 29, while the company is scheduled to debut on the stock exchanges on June 2.

headline: Aditya Birla Fashion Sets Rs 500 Crore Capex in FY26 To Fix Loss-Making Brands
description: ABFRL, with gross cash balance of Rs 2,350 crore following the recent fundraise, aims to expand aggressively in a bid to triple its revenue and double its profitability over the next five years.

headline: Aegis Vopak Terminals IPO subscribed 29% on Day 2: GMP slips to 3%
description: Aegis Vopak Terminals IPO saw low demand, with 29% subscription on Day 2 and a weakening GMP of Rs 8–9. Though strategically important in energy logistics, its premium valuation and limited past profitability raise caution. Retail investors must weigh long-term potential against risks before subscribing.

headline: Oyo Begins Discussions With Banks For IPO With $6-7 Billion Valuation
description: The renewed IPO push comes after Oyo had previously filed and refiled its draft papers with SEBI in 2021, seeking to raise Rs 8,430 crore through a public offering.

headline: Don’t Chase Hype: Anshul Saigal sticks to value over virality in stock selection
description: Anshul Saigal of Saigal Capital suggests that while early monsoons generally benefit India, fundamentals drive the market beyond short-term weather impacts. He favors broader market opportunities over expensive, unprofitable stocks like Zomato. Saigal is positive on the CDMO space due to potential gains from the China plus one strategy, while being cautious on generic pharma exports to the US.

headline: Defence Stocks On Fire: Mishra Dhatu, Garden Reach, Cochin Shipyard Shares Boost Gains
description: The Nifty India Defence index was also trading 1% higher at 11:30 a.m., outperforming  benchmarks Nifty 50 and Sensex, which barely erased day's losses.

headline: Indian IT Sector Sees Cash Conversion Dip As Growth Remains Market Focus, Says HSBC
description: TCS, the sector leader, has seen a steady fall in cash conversion over the past five years—from around 84% in fiscal 2020 to 73% in financial year 2025.

headline: Sagility shares hit 5% lower circuit as promoter launches Rs 2,671 crore stake sale via OFS
description: Sagility India promoter entity Sagility B.V., backed by private equity firm EQT, has launched a Rs 2,671 crore offer-for-sale (OFS). The sale includes up to 15.02% of the company’s equity, with a floor price of Rs 38 per share — an 11.4% discount to the last closing price. The OFS opens for non-retail investors on May 27 and for retail investors on May 28. This marks the second major stake sale by the promoter after the Rs 2,106 crore IPO in November 2023.

headline: Beyond credit ratings: Building a more multifaceted framework for assessing risk in alternative debt markets
description: The 2008 financial crisis exposed the limitations of relying solely on credit ratings, particularly in alternative debt markets. A more comprehensive risk assessment is needed, considering security enforcement, fraud, and issuer credit risk. Investors should supplement ratings with expert views and focus on legal enforceability, security composition, and governance for smarter capital allocation.

headline: NCLT defers hearing on Bhushan Power and Steel case, post Supreme Court status quo order on liquidation proceedings
description: On Monday, hearing a petition filed by JSW Steel, Supreme Court ordered status quo on Bhushan Power and Steel liquidation proceedings

headline: Supreme Court Rules In Favour Of Adani Power In Change In Law Compensation Case
description: The dispute related to a PPA signed for the supply of 1,200 MW of power at a fixed tariff.

headline: Samsung Galaxy A56 Users Face Booting Problem After Latest Update: Here Are Potential Solutions
description: The software update allows users to access Gemini by pressing the side button, and it also contains the May 2025 security patch.

headline: Garage meets and sleepless flights: How Nippon Steel's negotiator stuck at U.S. merger
description: Nippon steel’s ambitious merger with U.S. steel has been through a rocky journey before landing on a $14 million investment plan

headline: Sell-offs create rare windows to accumulate high-quality cos at bargain valuations: Anshul Saigal
description: Anshul Saigal of Saigal Capital identifies mispriced bets in sectors like metals, pharma, retail, financials, and capital goods, capitalizing on market corrections and US tariff uncertainties. He advises caution on the Mag-7 tech stocks and IT services due to potential consolidation and AI impact.

headline: Bayer CropScience shares soar 13% as Q4 profit jumps 49% YoY; board declares Rs 35 dividend
description: Bayer CropScience shares: Bayer CropScience shares experienced a significant surge. This followed the announcement of a 49% year-over-year jump in profit after tax for the fourth quarter of fiscal year 2025, reaching Rs 143.30 crore. The company also declared a dividend of Rs 35 per share for its eligible shareholders. Revenue from operations also increased to Rs 1,046.4 crore, up from Rs 792.

headline: Japan’s Central Banking Summit: Navigating Inflation and Growth Challenges
description: Japan’s central banking summit spotlights global monetary policy challenges as inflation surges and trade tensions mount.

headline: Three Satcom Players En Route To Permit Clearance; India To Accrue 10% 6G Patents: Telecom Minister
description: While 6G is still in nascent phase, India will play a seminal role in discussions around the standardisation of protocols and allocation of frequency spectrum, Jyotiraditya Scindia said.

headline: HSBC Cuts Dozens of Analyst Jobs In Investment Banking Overhaul
description: HSBC is combining macro strategy across asset classes including foreign exchange and fixed income, source says.

headline: Soft China dampens Asia LNG demand while Europe's imports ease: Russell
description: China’s appetite for LNG has reduced imports coming in to Asia by 4.5%, and simultaneously, Europe has been easing demand since March.

headline: Stock market update: Mining stocks  down  as market  falls
description: The 30-share BSE Sensex was  down  368.71 points at 81807.74

description: Prostarm Info Systems announced a price band of Rs 95 to Rs 105 per share for its initial public offering.

description: The broader segment of the market was mixed as the BSE Midcap was down 0.16% and Smallcap indices were up 0.10%.

headline: How Japan’s Overseas Investments Reached a Historic High
description: Japan's overseas assets hit a record ¥533.1 trillion in 2024, though it lost its top creditor status to Germany after 34 years.

headline: Mahindra & Mahindra, Laurus Labs —Check Shrikant Chouhan's Top Picks
description: These recommendations come with specific target prices and stop-loss levels, providing clear guidance for potential investments.

headline: BEML shares soar 22% in three days as Q4 earnings impress the D-Street
description: BEML Ltd shares jumped sharply following impressive Q4 results, with consolidated profit rising 11.9% year-on-year to Rs 287.55 crore. Revenue also increased to Rs 1,656.36 crore. While annual profit saw a marginal rise, revenue experienced a slight decline. Despite a past year decline, recent short-term momentum shows strong gains.

headline: These 5 F&O stocks saw a high increase in futures open interest
description: A significant uptick in futures open interest signifies a substantial growth in the number of active, unexpired futures contracts in a specific security.

headline: iPhone 17 Series: Camera To Design Overhaul, Key Features Creating Buzz Ahead Of September Launch
description: iPhone 17 Air will mark Apple's entry into the 'ultra-slim' market.

headline: Olectra Greentech Share Price Slumps 13% After Maharashtra Government Rescinds Order
description: Olectra Greentech, however, has not issued any official statement regarding cancellation of the order.

headline: Why is stock market falling today? Sensex slumps over 800 pts, Nifty slips below 24,800; 5 key reasons behind the decline
description: Stock Market Crash Today: Indian stock markets saw a sharp decline on Tuesday. Financial and IT stocks led the fall after a recent rally. Profit booking after a strong run-up and muted Q4 earnings growth contributed to the downturn. Rising U.S. Treasury yields and weak global cues also played a role. The RBI's dividend announcement disappointed some market expectations.

headline: Nibe Shares Hit Upper Circuit For Second Day — Here's Why Recently Listed Defence Stock Extended Gains
description: Nibe received an export order from a well-known international Israel-based defence firm.

headline: Beyond the Dollar: Lagarde's blueprint for a stronger Eurozone
description: For the euro to emerge as an alternative to the US dollar, the 20-nation eurozone must strengthen its financial systems and security capabilities.

headline: HFCs to benefit from revival in BFSI sector: Mayuresh Joshi
description: Early monsoons are boosting market sentiment, potentially cooling food inflation and paving the way for future rate cuts. This positive outlook favors the BFSI sector and related industries. Marketsmith India is optimistic about alco-beverages and agrochemical/fertilizer sectors, anticipating strong earnings growth. Select FMCG and retail players catering to rural markets are also poised for significant improvement.

headline: Bitter-sweet ride: 10 sugar stocks outperform Nifty with up to 77% returns, but 18 sink as much as 36%
description: The sugar sector presents a mixed bag for investors. While ten stocks outperformed Nifty, delivering returns up to 77%, eighteen others declined significantly. Bannari Amman Sugars leads the gainers, while Dhampur Bio Organics saw the sharpest fall. Factors like sugar production estimates and ethanol blending influence the sector. Experts advise monitoring stocks closely and considering companies with diverse revenue streams.

headline: Goldman Sachs sees 22% upside in Varun Beverages, starts coverage with Buy on long-term growth potential
description: Goldman Sachs initiated coverage on Varun Beverages with a 'buy' rating and a target price of Rs 600, highlighting strong execution and long-term growth potential in India's underpenetrated ready-to-drink market. The brokerage expects VBL to continue gaining market share, driven by leadership in fast-growing segments like energy and hydration drinks. Robust financials and a resilient distribution network further strengthen the growth outlook.

headline: Gold prices surge by Rs 5,160 from lower levels. Here’s what analysts predict
description: Gold prices rebounded sharply from recent lows, with June futures on MCX opening higher amid global uncertainties and a weaker dollar. Analysts attribute the gains to safe-haven buying triggered by geopolitical tensions and upcoming U.S. economic data. Experts expect gold and silver to remain volatile this week, advising a buy-on-dips strategy within defined support and resistance levels.

headline: Olectra Greentech shares tank 13% as Maha gov reportedly cancels big e-bus order
description: Olectra Greentech shares plummeted nearly 13% following reports of a cancelled electric bus order from the Maharashtra government due to procedural lapses. The contract, valued at approximately Rs 10,000 crore, involved the supply, operation, and maintenance of 5,150 electric buses. This cancellation has significantly impacted Olectra's stock performance, contributing to its year-to-date decline.

headline: Sensex drops 460 points in early trade
description: After two days of rally the Sensex and Nifty were dragged by IT stocks

headline: Buy NHPC, target price Rs 100:  JM Financial
description: JM Financial has a Buy call on NHPC, projecting a target price of Rs 100 within a year. NHPC's Q4FY25 consolidated total income rose 15.18% YoY, reaching Rs 2672.41 crore, with a net profit of Rs 919.52 crore. The company's green energy portfolio and significant hydro capacity additions in FY26/FY27 support the positive outlook.

headline: Olectra May Lose Maharashtra Order After Failing To Deliver 1,000 Buses On Time
description: The MSRTC had in July 2013 awarded a contract to Olectra Greentech to supply, operate, and maintain 5,150 electric buses.

headline: Narendra Solanki on where he is overweight and where underweight in current market
description: Narendra Solanki of Anand Rathi Shares suggests a stock-specific market. Banks and financials, especially public sector banks, look promising. FMCG, durables, consumer discretionary, and defence sectors also show potential. Domestic manufacturing, particularly electronics, and hospitals within pharma are attractive. In auto, two-wheelers like M&M, TVS Motor, and Hero MotoCorp are favored. The earning season was largely on expected lines.

headline: I-Sec maintains Buy on Oil India, revises target price to Rs 530
description: ICICI Securities maintains a Buy call on Oil India, revising the target price to Rs 530 from Rs 580 due to a weaker pricing environment and adjusted production estimates. Despite EPS revisions for FY26/27E, the brokerage anticipates a 24% upside from the current market price, driven by attractive valuations and a projected EPS CAGR of 22% between FY26-28E.

headline: Borana Weaves Shares Surge 18% Over Issue Price Post Listing
description: The company's share price rose as much as Rs 252 as of 10:00 a.m., marking a nearly 18% premium on the issue price and almost 4% above the listing price.

headline: Sagility India Share Price Hits Lower Circuit Limit As Promoter Plans Stake Sale
description: Sagility BV, has proposed selling up to 34,61,32,843 shares, which accounts for 7.39% of the total paid-up equity share capital.

headline: Kennametal India To Trade Ex-Dividend Wednesday — Today Is Last Day To Buy Shares For Eligibility
description: The last time Kennametal offered a dividend payout was in May 2023, at Rs 20 per share.

headline: Q4 Earnings Impact: Aurobindo Pharma, KEC International Shares Advance; Blue Dart, Brainbees Fall Over 4%
description: Bayer Corp. shares rose the most, while Olectra Greentech Ltd. fell the most, among the companies that announced their results for quarter ended March.

headline: Sensex falls 900 points, Nifty below 24,750 on global cues; IT, bank stocks drag
description: Indian equities opened lower on Tuesday amid weak global cues, with pressure seen across financials, IT, and auto stocks. Broader Asian markets remained subdued despite gains in U.S. futures. Investor sentiment was cautious ahead of key global events, while domestic institutional activity provided some support. Analysts expect markets to remain range-bound, with accumulation seen in select rate-sensitive sectors.

headline: KEI Industries, DCB Bank among 10 small-cap stocks analysts expect to gain up to 75%
description: Brokerages are optimistic about select smallcap stocks. Trendlyne data suggests potential gains in stocks like DCB Bank and PVR INOX. Analysts project returns of up to 75% for some. Other stocks with strong ratings include Pitti Engineering and Mahanagar Gas. Target prices indicate significant upside potential. These recommendations are based on expert analysis.

headline: Varun Beverages Share Price Rises As Goldman Sachs Bullish On India's Ready-To-Drink Beverage Story
description: The brokerage sees no disruption from Campa Cola's entry in the same space.

headline: Brainbees Solutions Share Price Falls After Q4 Operating Income, Margin Shrink
description: Ebitda was down 51.51% to Rs 16 crore from Rs 33 crore, while margin also contracted 115 basis points to 0.82% from 1.98%.

headline: These 4 stocks showed RSI Trending Up on May 26
Aurobindo Pharma Share Price Rises After Q4 Revenue Growth
description: Aurobindo Pharma reported a consolidated revenue increase of 10.6% year-on-year, reaching Rs 8,382 crore in Q4 FY25.

headline: Aurobindo Pharma shares jump 2% even as Q4 profit dips marginally to Rs 903 cr
description: Aurobindo Pharma shares: Aurobindo Pharma reported a marginal 0.4% YoY dip in Q4FY25 PAT to Rs 903 crore, even as revenue rose 10.6% to Rs 8,382 crore. For FY25, PAT rose 10% to Rs 3,484 crore. The company highlighted strong volume-led growth, record sales, and robust performance in its European operations.

headline: Rupee Weakens Against Dollar At Open
description: The rupee is expected to trade in the range of 84.75 to 85.50.

headline: I-Sec downgrades Nalco to Hold; lowers target price to Rs 190
description: ICICI Securities has adjusted its rating for National Aluminium Company. The brokerage firm now recommends a 'Hold' position. The target price has been revised to Rs 190 from Rs 205. This decision reflects expectations of subdued alumina prices. Supplies from China and India are expected to increase. Limited volume growth is also anticipated in the near term.

headline: Stocks to buy in 2025: NTPC, Stove Kraft among 5 stocks that could give 11-60% return
description: We have collated a list of recommendations from top brokerage firms from ETNow and other sources.

headline: Stocks To Buy: Action Construction, Computer Age Management, Container Corp, Jubilant Pharmova, Laurus Labs
description: Analysts have 'buy' recommendation on stocks from the pharma, automobile manufacturing, and shipping industries.

headline: ETMarkets Smart Talk: Diversify across equities, debt, and alternatives to preserve wealth, Anil Rego advises HNWIs
description: In today's volatile market, wealth preservation is key for HNWIs. Anil Rego advises diversification across equities, fixed income, and alternatives to manage risks and capture growth. He suggests focusing on sectors like consumer discretionary and infrastructure, while maintaining a gold allocation for portfolio stability, but advises caution on increasing gold holdings immediately.

headline: IndusInd Bank shares in focus amid NFRA complaint over audit discrepancies
description: NFRA has received a complaint highlighting audit lapses tied to the bank’s forex derivatives. The irregularities, flagged internally, may have a financial impact of Rs 2,100 crore pre-tax. Regulatory bodies, including the RBI, SEBI, and ICAI, are scrutinising the matter. Meanwhile, key resignations have followed amid accounting gaps in the microlending business.

headline: Fusion Finance Has CLSA Cautiously Optimistic On Future Growth — Here's Why
description: Fusion Finance's management, including newly appointed CEO Sanjay Galli, has indicated that better clarity on full-year growth will be provided only after the Q1 FY26 results.

headline: JM Financial maintains Buy on ITC, lowers target price to Rs 500
description: JM Financial suggests buying ITC shares. They predict a target price of Rs 500. ITC's March quarter results were satisfactory. Cigarette sales increased, but FMCG growth was slow. Agri business performed well. The demerger of Hotels business will reduce capex. The firm believes ITC's valuation is attractive. They expect earnings per share to grow by June 2027.

headline: Coal India unit CMPDIL files for initial public offering
description: Central Mine Planning and Design Institute Limited, a Coal India unit, has filed for an IPO. Coal India will sell about 71.4 million shares. The company provides consultancy services for mine planning. SBI Capital Markets and IDBI Capital Markets are managing the IPO. Many companies are delaying their IPO plans for 2025.

headline: Sensex soars 10,000 points from April lows. But India Inc’s Q4 numbers expose cracks in market rally
description: Despite the Sensex's impressive 10,000-point surge, Q4 earnings growth for Nifty companies is a modest under 6%, raising concerns about market valuations. While the market anticipates a strong FY26, analysts caution about global economic uncertainties and potential EPS downgrades. Midcaps and smallcaps outperformed, but overall, earnings need to catch up to justify current market highs.

headline: IndiGo co-founder Rakesh Gangwal to offload Rs 11,300 crore stake via block deal
description: IndiGo shares: Rakesh Gangwal plans to sell a stake in IndiGo through a block deal worth ₹11,300 crore, managed by Goldman Sachs, Morgan Stanley, and JPMorgan, as part of his gradual exit strategy. Despite a recent 62% year-on-year rise in net profit for the March quarter, IndiGo's full-year net profit fell 11%.

headline: Tata Motors shares in focus as global tax outgo touches Rs 38,892 cr in FY25
description: Tata Motors paid Rs 38,892 crore in global taxes and contributions in FY25, a 1% dip from FY24, due to lower direct tax outgo. Indirect taxes rose 31% YoY. Despite lower taxes, FY25 net profit declined to Rs 28,149 crore. The stock, down 24% in one year, has rebounded over 10% in the past month.

headline: India playing leadership role in adoption of next-generation barcodes and global standards that support transparency, traceability, and sustainability says GS1 CEO
Markets likely to trend and hit new highs in H2; 3 themes to deliver multi-year returns: Nitin Raheja
description: Nitin Raheja anticipates a consumption revival driven by factors like falling inflation, interest rate cuts, and a strong monsoon, benefiting rural-focused sectors and FMCG. He remains optimistic about premium consumption, manufacturing, and EMS, expecting markets to hit new highs in the second half, fueled by domestic consumption and a good festival season.

headline: Negative Breakout on May 26: These 7 stocks drop below their 200 DMAs
Nazara Technologies shares in focus after Q4 revenue nearly doubles; net profit surges to Rs 4 crore
description: Nazara Technologies’ Q4FY25 revenue nearly doubled to Rs 520.2 crore, with net profit rising to Rs 4 crore. Despite higher marketing and employee expenses, esports and gaming segments showed strong growth. The company plans global expansion through acquisitions like Curve Games. Analysts maintain a ‘Hold’ rating, with an average target price of Rs 979, reflecting cautious optimism.

headline: 4 new IPOs coming; should you go for them? Here’s how Abhishek Gaoshinde rates them
description: Abhishek Gaoshinde offers cautious ratings for upcoming IPOs, citing concerns over debt repayment visibility for Aegis Vopak, limited financial history and valuation for Schloss, and working capital intensive business models for Prostarm and Scoda. He also highlights a potential conflict of interest for Aegis Vopak due to Aegis Logistics' similar business.

headline: TCS Share Price Live Updates: TCS Closes at Rs 3514.6
Positive Breakout: These 3 stocks cross above their 200 DMAs
description: As long as the stock is priced above the 200-day SMA on the daily time frame, it is generally considered to be an overall uptrend.

headline: Nikita Papers IPO opens today: GMP, price band among key things to know
description: Nikita Papers launched its IPO on May 27, aiming to raise Rs 67.54 crore through a fresh issue, with the price fixed between Rs 95 and Rs 104 per share. Despite a neutral grey market premium, the company plans to use the IPO proceeds for a new power plant and working capital. The firm reported a profit of Rs 16.

headline: Brainbees Solutions Q4 Review: India Gross Merchandise Value Rises But Margin Missed Morgan Stanley Estimates
description: Home brands' share in India GMV stood at 55% in 2025, compared to 37% in 200, the brokerage noted.

headline: Varun Beverages Fizzing With Potential — Goldman Sachs Initiates 'Buy'
description: Superior execution and strong earnings growth justify Varun Beverage's premium valuation, according to Goldman Sachs.

headline: After robust IPO subscription, Borana Weaves shares to list today. Here's what GMP suggests
description: Borana Weaves is set to debut on the stock exchanges with a strong grey market premium of Rs 40, indicating a potential 18.52% listing gain. The IPO was heavily oversubscribed, reflecting robust investor confidence in the company's expansion plans and synthetic fabric manufacturing business. Proceeds from the IPO will fund a new facility in Surat and support working capital needs.

headline: LIC to announce Q4 results today: Here's what to expect from the state-owned insurer
description: LIC is set to announce its Q4 results today, with analysts expecting a mixed performance—profitability and VNB margins may improve, but new business premium growth remains under pressure. PAT is estimated to rise 7% YoY to Rs 14,800 crore. All eyes will be on LIC’s future strategy, product pipeline, and AUM trajectory, which may touch Rs 62 lakh crore.

headline: GIC Re Q4 profit falls 17% as underwriting turns negative
description: GIC Re’s combined ratio rose sharply to 103.56% in Q4 FY25 from 89.26% a year earlier, indicating a deterioration in underwriting efficiency. The company booked an underwriting loss of Rs 392 crore in Q4 FY25, compared to an underwriting profit of Rs 570 crore in the year-ago quarter. Despite this, GIC Re’s board has recommended a dividend of Rs 10 per equity share for FY25.

headline: Are we ready to cure cancer?
description: An explainer about the CRISPR gene editing technology and the growing calls to freeze the very science that pulls it off.

headline: SBI Life technical setup turns bullish; key support at Rs 1,750, says expert
Reliance Infrastructure Q4 net profit rises to Rs 4,387 crore
description: Reliance Infrastructure reported a net profit of ₹4,387.08 crore for Q4 2024-25, a significant turnaround from the ₹220 crore loss in the same period last year. The full fiscal year saw a consolidated profit of ₹4,938 crore, contrasting sharply with the previous year's ₹1,609 crore loss.

headline: Oil edges down as potential higher OPEC+ output eyed
description: Oil prices experienced a slight dip as investors anticipated a potential increase in crude oil output from OPEC+ during their upcoming meeting. The group is expected to finalize July output, potentially increasing production by 411,000 barrels per day. Trade talk extensions between the U.S. and EU provided some support, while the possibility of failed U.S.

headline: Breaking News Live: Car Ploughs Into Liverpool Fans In Northwest England
description: The incident resulted in 27 people being hospitalised, with two sustaining serious injuries

headline: Gold edges higher as dollar dips, US fiscal worries mount
description: Gold prices saw a slight increase. This rise is due to a weaker dollar and worries about the United States' financial situation. Investors are watching for more news on trade policies. This follows President Trump's delay of tariff hikes on European goods. Silver and platinum also experienced price movements. Market participants are awaiting key economic data releases.

headline: Dollar stutters as US tax debate grinds on; yen gains
description: The dollar is facing challenges as investors worry about the impact of the proposed tax and spending bill. This bill could increase the U.S. debt. Global markets and the euro saw gains after the U.S. delayed tariffs on Europe. The U.S. Senate will now debate the tax-cut bill. The dollar index has declined for three straight sessions.

headline: Sensex Today | Stock Market LIVE Updates: GIFT Nifty signals a muted start; Asian shares trade mixed
Gold And Silver Price Today— Check Prices In Mumbai, Bengaluru, Delhi, Chennai And More
description: The gold spot price was also down 0.62% as it traded at $3,344.89 on Tuesday.

headline: Regulatory Outlook For Online Gaming Sector In India
description: The lack of an adequate distinction between online games of skill and chance creates a significant regulatory gap.

headline: Ashok Leyland Aims To Make EV Arm Switch Mobility Fund Own Capex
description: CEO Shenu Agarwal describes the decision to issue a bonus as a gesture to 'reward our shareholders further'.

headline: JSW Steel Eyes 10% Volume Growth In FY26 On Strong Demand, Operational Efficiency
description: JSW Steel remains on track for its 2031 expansion targets, and the Bhushan Power & Steel Ltd. issue does not derail this plan, says CEO Jayant Acharya.

headline: eClerx Services Targets 24-28% Ebitda Margin In FY26 On Strong Sales, Large Deals
description: BFSI and cable media segments will drive growth in the next two to three quarters, according to the company’s CFO Srinivasan Nadadhur.

headline: 'Expect To Launch Altiva SIF In Hybrid Category In Couple Of Months': Edelweiss Mutual Funds CEO Radhika Gupta
description: Edelweiss Asset Management recently got approval from SEBI for the Altiva SIF platform.

headline: Gold Holds Decline As EU-US Trade Talks Weigh On Haven Demand
description: Demand for safe assets like gold has been impacted as signs emerge that the White House may be making progress in negotiations with some trading partners.

headline: Can Titan maintain strong growth despite challenges from high gold prices?
description: According to Emkay Global Financial Services, Titan observed an impact on consumer sentiment due to high gold prices, in gold jewellery, within the sub-₹50,000 price band. In the higher price band, buyer growth was seen with higher demand for simple designs that attracted lower making charges. To offer more options to consumers amid steep gold prices, Titan has introduced a 9-carat collection in its Caratlane business to make products affordable.

headline: Asian shares start cautiously, dollar edges down
description: Asian shares opened cautiously amid anticipation of fresh trade news influencing US asset demand. The dollar weakened as trade tensions and US fiscal concerns persisted. Investors are closely monitoring President Trump's trade dealings with Japan and India, while China pushes for yuan usage in cross-border trade. Nvidia's results and the upcoming US inflation data will be key events this week.

headline: Oil Steadies As Traders Focus On EU Trade Talks, OPEC+ Meeting
description: Brent traded below $65 a barrel after a quiet session on Monday due to holidays in London and New York, while West Texas Intermediate was little changed near $61.

headline: Petrol, Diesel Prices Unchanged On May 27; Here's How Much You Pay For Fuel Now
description: In Mumbai, petrol is priced at Rs 103.50 per litre, and diesel costs Rs 90.03.

headline: How will RBI's Rs 2.69 lakh crore dividend impact bond yields?
description: Indian benchmark yields saw minimal movement as the RBI's ₹2.69 lakh crore dividend payout, though substantial, underwhelmed market expectations. Short-term yields are anticipated to decrease due to ample liquidity, potentially steepening the yield curve. An influx of over ₹70,000 crore in extra liquidity, coupled with the dividend transfer, is expected to further soften T-bill yields.

headline: Asian, US Stock Futures Rise On EU Trade Deal Hope: Markets Wrap
description: Contracts for the S&P 500 and Nasdaq 100 jumped over 1% in early trade after a public holiday in the US and the UK Monday.

headline: Why are late-stage startups relying on private credit before their IPOs?
description: Late-stage Indian startups like InMobi, Zepto, and Zetwerk are increasingly securing private credit before their IPOs. This strategy allows them to buy out early investors, streamline their capital structures, and potentially increase valuations. These deals, typically costing 14-18% annually, are repaid from IPO proceeds, offering private credit funds downside protection and equity upside potential as companies prepare for public listings.

headline: Rupee fluctuates against dollar, closes at 85.09
description: Traders suggest the dollar-buying was on by nationalised banks and importers, while dollar sellers could be unhedged exporters. Dollar index was weaker at 98.6 in early hours of trading, and gained during the day towards 99.4 levels, adding pressure on rupee, traders said.

headline: Stocks in news: LIC, Firstcry, IndiGo, Nazara Tech, Tata Motors
description: Indian markets opened positively, driven by Friday's rebound. LIC and Info Edge are set to release Q4 results. Firstcry's losses widened, while Nazara Tech saw a significant profit increase. IndiGo's co-founder plans to sell a stake, and Tata Motors reported its tax contributions, marking key developments influencing market activity.

headline: Pre-market action: Here's the trade setup for today's session
description: Indian equities continued their upward trend, fueled by positive global cues as the US delayed tariffs on the EU. Analysts anticipate further gains due to strong domestic macros and supportive global market trends. The rupee strengthened, and FIIs reduced their net short positions in the futures market, contributing to the overall positive sentiment.

headline: Sebi prescribes appointment process of senior executives at MIIs
description: To bolster governance, Sebi mandated a structured process for appointing key management personnel (KMPs) at market infrastructure institutions (MIIs). Independent agencies will identify candidates for roles like compliance officer and CTO. The nomination and remuneration committee (NRC) will evaluate recommendations before the governing board makes the final decision, ensuring appropriate stature and independence.

headline: Sebi fines MCX Rs 25 Lakh for disclosure lapses
description: Sebi has levied a ₹25 lakh penalty on Multi Commodity Exchange of India (MCX) due to insufficient disclosures concerning payments made to 63 Moons Technologies for software services. The regulator found lapses in disclosing payments related to the trading software contract. MCX is required to pay the fine within 45 days, as per Sebi's order.

headline: Hot Stocks: 4 stocks that may give returns between 15-57%
description: Analysts predict significant growth for select stocks, with potential returns ranging from 15% to 57%. Aurum Proptech is expected to benefit from the expanding proptech sector, while Radico Khaitan aims to increase its premium whisky market share. GMR Airports anticipates EBITDA growth, and GE Vernova T&D India foresees strong demand and earnings growth.

headline: India invites BRICS nations to boost startup cooperation
description: This is the first-of-its-kind dedicated platform for BRICS nations, aimed at enhancing cross-border collaboration and strengthening startup ecosystems across member countries.

headline: NSE to add Kfin,360 One, Amber, and PG Electro in F&O trading
description: The exchange said the futures and options contracts on these securities would be available for trading with effect from June 27. "The market lot and scheme of strikes of the above mentioned securities shall be informed to members on June 26, through a separate circular," said NSE's circular.

headline: Eternal shares drop 4.5% on foreign shareholding cap
description: Eternal's shares declined 4.5% due to the company's decision to limit foreign shareholding to 49.5%, potentially triggering significant selling by overseas passive funds. Nuvama Alternative & Quantitative Research estimates outflows ranging from $820 million to $1.3 billion as MSCI and FTSE benchmarks reduce the stock's weightage. This shift stems from Eternal's move to become an Indian Owned & Controlled Company.

headline: Sebi limits expiry of derivatives contracts to Tuesdays or Thursdays
description: Stock exchanges will now have to seek prior approval from the regulator for modifying the settlement day of their derivatives contracts from the one which has been existing. Under the current framework, stock exchanges could decide upon the expiry day of their derivatives products.

headline: India Focused On Ensuring Customer Safety On Digital Highway, Says Scindia
description: The country is not only making indigenous telecom products, and ensuring services are ubiquitous, it is also prioritising the safety of customers, he said.

headline: Vedanta Plans World Class Higher Educational Institute In Puri, Says Anil Agarwal
description: It will be a not-for-profit, digital-first university with the best faculty and students from India and abroad, he said.

headline: India's PC Market Grows 8.1% To 3.3 Million Units; HP Leads With 29% Share
description: HP continues to lead the space with a 29.1% market share, while Lenovo recorded the highest growth at 34.8% year-on-year

headline: TCS splits AI.Cloud business unit for higher growth
description: TCS splits AI.Cloud unit for higher growth, focusing on AI and Cloud separately to tap into untapped market potential

headline: Rupee volatility may be back when tariff deadline ends, say experts
Byju's Learning App Delisted From Google Playstore Due To Non-Payment To Vendor
description: Byju's Leaning App covered mathematics, physics, chemistry and biology for classes 4-12 and social studies for classes 6–8 as well.

headline: Toyota achieves cumulative sales of 3 lakh units of Fortuner, Legender SUVs
Government Removes Port Restrictions On Certain Value-Added Leather Products
description: This step is expected to reduce the compliance burden and improve ease of doing business for exporters.

headline: Government Imposes Curbs On Imports Of Cabinet Hinges, Roller Chains
description: Importers of both these goods would have to seek permission or a license from the DGFT if the import prices are below the specified rates.

headline: Lupin, SteinCares ink pact to roll out biosimilar for eye disease in Latin America
Aurobindo Pharma Q4 net almost flat at ₹903 crore
SBI Life Insurance, Vidyaniti buy 4.25% unit-holding in NHIT for Rs 1,100 crore
description: SBI Life Insurance and Vidyaniti LLP invested in National Highways Infra Trust. They bought a 4.25% stake for Rs 1,100 crore. NHAI divested 8.24 crore units in the Trust. SBI Life Insurance acquired 1.93% holding. Vidyaniti LLP secured a 2.3% unit-holding. The units were priced at Rs 133.57 each. NHAI offloaded its units at the same rate.

headline: Mota-Engil CEO Says Company Stock Worth Twice Its Current Value
description: Mota-Engil is down 27% since it released results for the first half-year on Aug. 28 and short sellers ramped up bets against the stock.

headline: India shipped 3.3 million PCs in Q1 of calendar year 2025: IDC
description: The commercial desktop category, however, declined 2.5% due to 27.4% YoY decline in the government segment, reports IDC

headline: Optimistic about achieving 10-12% credit growth for FY26: Indian Bank MD Binod Kumar
description: ‘The two interest rate cuts by the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) and also expectations of further cuts is likely to spur credit demand’
